thread.title: 10 stats to know for the Rutgers-Ohio State game
thread.title_full: 10 stats to know for the Rutgers-Ohio State game

author: Dan Duggan | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 10 stats to know for the Rutgers-Ohio State game
text:
Comments 
PISCATAWAY â€” Rutgers and Ohio State will square off on Saturday night ( 8 p.m., ABC ) at High Point Solutions Stadium. 
The odds are against Rutgers (3-3) upsetting No. 1 Ohio State (7-0), as the Buckeyes are 21-point favorites . Here are10 key stats to keep in mind for Saturday's matchup: 
20: Ohio State has won 20 straight games entering Saturday's game. Buckeyes coach Urban Meyer has had four 20-game winning streaks during his career. 
.851: Meyer has an .851 career winning percentage, which is tops among active coaches with at least 10 years of experience. 
0.7: Cleveland.com game Rutgers a 0.7 percent chance of beating Ohio State in the offseason. 
1: Ohio State had one punt in last season's 56-17 win over Rutgers . The Buckeyes went 5-for-9 on third down and 2-for-3 on third down in last year's meeting. 
12: Ohio State has allowed 12 pass plays of 20-plus yard this season, which ranks fourth nationally. Rutgers has 18 pass plays of 20-plus yards this season, which is tied for 79th nationally. 
0-121: Teams were 0-121 when trailing by 25 points entering last weekend. Rutgers overcame a 25-point deficit in the final 18 minutes of last Saturday's 55-52 win over Indiana. 
PLUS: Five keys to the Rutgers-Ohio State game 
11.0: Rutgers linebacker Steve Longa leads the Big Ten with 11.0 tackles per game. 
48.7: Rutgers is converting 48.7 percent of its third downs, which ranks 10th nationally and leads the Big Ten. Ohio State is allowing opponents to convert 31.3 percent of third downs, which ranks third in the Big Ten. 
75.0: Rutgers quarterback Chris Laviano is completing 75 percent of his first-down passes this season. Laviano leads the Big Ten with a 69.2 completion percentage. 
5.4: Rutgers' running backs are averaging at least 5.4 yards per carry. Robert Martin (6.2 ypc) leads the way, followed by Paul James (5.9) and Josh Hicks (5.4)
